title: Intermittent Lag spikes
body: Ever since I switched to OCE servers, I have always experienced intermittent lag spikes. Probably every 30-60 seconds for approx 3 second duration. Its quite the gamebreaker for me sadly. I've had my last straw with it now, so I need to fix it. Im with Telstra cable with 35mbps down and 1mbps up. Im connected to my router via a powerline unit as the wifi would be too weak. Im hoping its some kind of firewall problem I can fix and no just a bad ISP or connection because of the powerline unit. If anyone could help, that would be great.

replies.body:
Telstra is not a backbone provider, so it *could* be them. But from what I've heard they've actually been pretty well-behaved when it comes to using the most efficient route to connect you.

In the massive majority of cases, using Wifi or not doesn't actually improve your speed at all because of how sophisticated the technology itself has become. It's almost always with something else.

Have you tried turning off any and all automatic updates on your system, including third-party ones? Have you tried disabling your anti-virus and firewall while playing?

I'll have a look, but I doubt its automatic updates that would be causing it. Regarding AV and firewall, Im not sure if I have an AV (pretty safe with my browsing) and if there even is a firewall its probably the default windows 8 one. Would this be causing the problem and if so, how can I fix it? Would it be a problem with ports on the router? Getting pretty desperate to fix it now. I never lag in other online games, ie BF4.

>Im not sure if I have an AV (pretty safe with my browsing)

AV is mainly to prevent attacks, which you simply can't alter by not visiting certain sites. But do what you think is best; I'm just letting you know.

>if there even is a firewall its probably the default windows 8 one.

If you didn't turn it off intentionally, Windows Firewall will be fully functioning. Try disabling it. You can do so by locating it in the Control Panel under Security and Maintenance.

>Would it be a problem with ports on the router?

It might be. Have you recently checked your current configuration against the user manual? Have the technologies its supported changed since you got it?

>I never lag in other online games, ie BF4.

That's all circumstantial. For instance, not all online games will connect you to a regional server to play. Some will even tell you to make your own server. Some connect you straight from client to client, no server. Among that there's many other things, so saying you can connect to other games fine doesn't really mean anything in this case.

If all else fails, try methodically going through [this page](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues). If you need any help with that, just ask.

Best of luck.
Yeah I know its to prevent attacks too, I really need to work on getting one sometime! Ill go through that checklist and hopefully will have some luck! Thanks for the advice. :)

One thing that page doesn't say to do is to make sure all the cables are plugged in right and that everything's turned on. You would not believe how much time I've spent troubleshooting an issue when the problem was just a disconnected plug somewhere along the line.

So, have you found a solution?
Unfortunately I am still experiencing it :( an issue with the ISP?

Could be. You're 100% sure that you play all other games without this sort of lag? Are you sure you had no other applications open while playing League?

You might want to call them up for their support, as well as [making a support ticket for Riot to look over](https://support.leagueoflegends.com/anonymous_requests/new).

I've never experienced lag while playing any other online games. Sadly this is the only exception. I dont have anything downloading on my computer (we have a HTPC that downloads the odd tv show episode or movie) but I dont think this would affect my connection in the way that it is behaving. Ill give Riot a shot, see if that can help! Thanks again :)

I'm very sorry that we couldn't fix the problem. I really do hate it when this happens. But some things just can't be fixed without professional help.

If you ever have any other problems with the game, don't be afraid to come back here!
